meanings.definition: A median is a strip of land dividing a road.
meanings.sent1: The medians on the highway help separate the lanes of traffic.
meanings.sent2: Be careful when crossing the street, always use the median.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the median was a perfect place to stop and eat its acorn.
meanings.sent4: The median stood like a green barrier between the two sides of the road.
meanings.sent5: The flowers planted on the median added a touch of beauty to the busy street.

meanings.definition: A median is a value that separates the higher half from the lower half of a data set.
meanings.sent1: In statistics, the median helps us understand the middle value of a set.
meanings.sent2: The median income of the group was used to determine their financial status.
meanings.sent3: The median number of cookies each person ate at the party was surprisingly high.
meanings.sent4: She found herself in the median of opinions, not fully agreeing with either side.
meanings.sent5: The median line on the graph clearly showed where the data split into two halves.

meanings.definition: Medians is the plural form of median.
meanings.sent1: When discussing data, we often need to calculate medians to get a clearer picture.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to find the medians of their test scores.
meanings.sent3: The medians of the class were all different, showing a wide range of results.
meanings.sent4: The medians of the roads in the city were all beautifully landscaped.
meanings.sent5: The medians of the numbers were easy to identify once the data was sorted.
